reviewText: Very little actual footage or pictures of the shooting.  :(

It was free on Amazon Prime so I watched it.  It was pretty entertaining but I wouldn't pay money to watch this promo.  Pretty much everyone was entertaining and had good stories, except Jeff Cohen brought up residuals and plays lawyer the whole time he's on camera.  Way to live up to the stereotype..  It was also pretty obvious by his body language that he lied about pulling hair.
A great documentary if you liked "The Goonies" A great additional value if you are an Amazon Prime subscriber.
Would have been worth the price tag even if it is short documentary but with it being a cheap DVDR it isn't worth the price. It should have stated that it was a "burn" in the product description..

The documentary itself, although short (around 24 minutes), is great.. But once it started I realized this was a documentary that I had seen a year or two ago on YouTube... Ok, then onto the "extra interviews"... Which I had also seen on YouTube.  There are some interesting stories here for goonies fans that didn't fit into the context of the actual doc.  Ok, well I'm a collector so it'll be cool to have the dvd in my collection, right?  Oh wait, it's a DVDR with a inkjet printed label.

All that being said, the cover is nice and glossy.

If you are a goonies completist or have yet to see this doc, and don't mind paying for a DVDR with a printed label, definitely pick this up.

If you've seen this footage before, save your money and watch the film on YouTube.
Great trip down memory lane, and nice to hear what went into bringing this gem to life.
Very good show

Interesting retrospective into the making of the film. There is a nice mix of recent and archival footage. Sean Astin only gets a minute or two of screen time, which was disappointing. Some interesting stories about the legacy of the movie and its effect on the stars.

I loved the Goonies years ago and I still love it today. The dialogue between the characters is not just funny but real. The location for filming (Astoria, Oregon) is the perfect backdrop for this adventure. This is a movie that will never go out of style.
If you're a Goonies fan it a nice short documentary with most of the cast taking about their experiences then, and today, with a movie that holds fond memories for old and new fans.

It's Great that finally there's a Documentary made on the film the Goonies
one of my favourites i Grew up watching the film
but the interviews have been filmed by Independent company Jansen media
Definitelty not warner bros who owns the film, as if warners would make the effort to produce a retrospectve featurette
on the making of the film
so i bought this dvd out of curiousity to see if it's worth watching, not really worth it not for $10
well the Duration on the back cover says 90mins 2014 Jansen media
this is bulls*** it's Definitely not a 90min Doco, and the interviews were recorded back in 2010 not 2014
first of all, you get a 25min retrospective featurette with
Richard Donner, Jeff Cohen, Sean Astin, Corey Feldman, Robert Davi, Joe Pantoliano
Curtis Hanson, the mayor of Astoria from 1983 is interviewed and that's it
no interviews with Josh Brolin, Kerri Green or Martha Plimpton
and that's the credits roll and goes back to main menu where you select Bonus interviews which only goes for about 30mins
so it's a 55min Doco, not 90mins what Bulls***
the extra interviews are with the same people from the retrospective featurette
the extra interviews are mainly behind the scenes stories and about the Goonies fans etc
some of it is worth watching, some of it is just boring, as a big Goonies fan i was expecting more footage
more interviews with Josh brolin, Kerri Green or martha plimpton at least but no
this Doco is very independently made so maybe Jansen could not get all the actors from the film to be interviewed
the DVD is all regions so if you want a copy it's only worth $5 or less,
amazon are selling it for $10 which i think is ripoff based on the content you pay for.
about 2-3 stars for this dvd meaning it's average produced

I live in Astoria, OR where "The Goonies" was filmed and every year, one of the biggest local festivals is "Goonie Week".  It is so amazing to see people come from all over the world to take part in it.  Though my kids loved it, I still have a hard time understanding the phenomenon of attachment to the movie.  I can be walking down to the grocery store, any time of the year, and have people stop me and ask me "where is the Goonie house".  In the summer, people pour into town to see the "Goonie Museum" and to go out on the pirate ship that comes down for the festival from Grays Harbor, WA, or take part in the re-enactments that the coordinators set up around town.  Though I don't really get the fame of the movie, it has been great for our little town.  So, thanks to all of you from the "Goonies' cast and crew for filming it here in our wonderful little town.  Oh, and by the way, it is fun to see all these folks in this short little film, telling about the filming and why they chose our town for
the setting and how much fun they had making the movie.
Great documentary wish it was longer.

The show was (and remains) a true screen gem.  This behind the scenes look at the making of the movie is a special treat, and the only problem that I had was that it was not longer!  Only some of the actors were available (none of the female leads were interviewed) but it was a tribute in many ways to the determination of filmmakers to overcome adversity and to make a vision come to life.  Short and sweet, and unofficial, but worth watching for all the goonies who still watch the film with no hesitation.
It' okay but that's it. I won't say it was a waste of time because it's pretty short. There is just not a lot of content.
No footage from the movie was disappointing but it was nice to hear from the actors. Also, some of the stories were missed. Like when the kids first saw the ship.
A good as were gonna get making of special. I do recommend watching it.
Very cool to see! I of course wish it was longer, but it has interviews with the actors, director, and others to give a pretty good insight on the making of the film.

I like this movie, but hadn't seen it in several years, when I recently saw it on TV.  I love the fun and creative story line of this Spielberg adventure.  There are several good actors in it ( who are grown now) Sean Astin,  Josh Brolin, Martha Plimpton, and a very funny guy, Chunk, played by Jeff Cohen.  As this group of kids follow a map looking for pirate treasure, they run into bad guys, caves with traps, and  a ghost ship.  This is classic Spielberg, and a movie you will not grow tired of.  There is some language and innuendo that I think is inappropriate, so I would recommend it for kids 13 and up.
This was fun!
Boring

wish it was longer

AWESOME WITH PRIME

This is awesome with Amazon Prime because it's free. It's not worth paying money for though. (Unless you're like a SUPER fan of the Goonies, which I would totally understand!)

It's just a collection of interviews shot randomly with the case and crew of the movie talking about experiences making the film. It's a really neat look into the movie and the movie making process.

You will learn things like how the Fratelli brothers (the actors) hated each other in real life. So their constant bickering in the movie was really just them bicking.

It's a great way to spent a half hour if you're a Goonies fan and you have Amazon Prime so you can watch it at no extra cost. It's probably not worth $3.
Interesting enough

I've been looking for this documentary a long time. Kind of way too short & not really a documentary. But a must watch for hardcore GOONIES! Someone really needs to make a legit DOCUMENTARY.  This is like a special feature on a 25h anniversary DVD.

I was excited when I saw this documentary, but when I saw the length of it I was disappointed before I even started it. It's simply much too short! Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed watching it and hearing the behind the scenes stories, but just as the story was starting to get interesting, they'd cut quickly to the next story. They hint at the octopus deleted scene, but then don't really talk much about it. There was potential for an amazing look behind the scenes, but the quick cutting just doesn't let the documentary reach the full potential. The lack of many cast members was also disappointing, but that's probably more about availability.
The joy of childhood dreams and hidden treasure on and off shore. Gold and treasure of the human heart.
I love the movie "The Goonies" & even though this was a short documentary I still enjoyed it!

Dated material and doesn't include the entire cast and crew. Wish there was more about the cultural impact it made on people who have enjoyed the film through the years.

Watched this video to find out more about the actual movie.  The editing was annoying with choppy cuts for each person interviewed.  It seemed more like a college level film student's first attempt at a short film.  It did not explore locations in Astoria OR, in depth where the movie was filmed.  It focused on the interaction between film's stars.
